trans-unit.source: The ObjectModelRoot Object
trans-unit.target: The ObjectModelRoot Object

trans-unit.source: powershell,cmdlet
trans-unit.target: powershell,cmdlet

trans-unit.source: The ObjectModelRoot Object
trans-unit.target: The ObjectModelRoot Object

trans-unit.source: The **$psISE** object, which is the principal root object in Windows PowerShellÂ® Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE) is an instance of the Microsoft.PowerShell.Host.ISE.ObjectModelRoot class.
trans-unit.target: The **$psISE** object, which is the principal root object in Windows PowerShellÂ® Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE) is an instance of the Microsoft.PowerShell.Host.ISE.ObjectModelRoot class.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes the properties of the **ObjectModelRoot** object.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes the properties of the **ObjectModelRoot** object.

trans-unit.source: Properties
trans-unit.target: Properties

trans-unit.source: CurrentFile
trans-unit.target: CurrentFile

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: The read-only property that gets the file, which is associated with this host object that currently has the focus.
trans-unit.target: The read-only property that gets the file, which is associated with this host object that currently has the focus.

trans-unit.source: CurrentPowerShellTab
trans-unit.target: CurrentPowerShellTab

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: The read-only property that gets the PowerShell tab that has the focus.
trans-unit.target: The read-only property that gets the PowerShell tab that has the focus.

trans-unit.source: CurrentVisibleHorizontalTool
trans-unit.target: CurrentVisibleHorizontalTool

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: The read-only property that gets the currently visible Windows PowerShell ISE add-on tool that is located in the horizontal tool pane at the bottom of the editor.
trans-unit.target: The read-only property that gets the currently visible Windows PowerShell ISE add-on tool that is located in the horizontal tool pane at the bottom of the editor.

trans-unit.source: CurrentVisibleVerticalTool
trans-unit.target: CurrentVisibleVerticalTool

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: The read-only property that gets the currently visible Windows PowerShell ISE add-on tool that is located in the vertical tool pane on the right side of the editor.
trans-unit.target: The read-only property that gets the currently visible Windows PowerShell ISE add-on tool that is located in the vertical tool pane on the right side of the editor.

trans-unit.source: Options
trans-unit.target: Options

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: The read-only property that gets the various options that can change settings in Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: The read-only property that gets the various options that can change settings in Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: PowerShellTabs
trans-unit.target: PowerShellTabs

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: The read-only property that gets the collection of the PowerShell tabs, which are open in Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: The read-only property that gets the collection of the PowerShell tabs, which are open in Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: By default, this object contains one PowerShell tab.
trans-unit.target: By default, this object contains one PowerShell tab.

trans-unit.source: However, you can add more PowerShell tabs to this object by using scripts or by using the menus in Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: However, you can add more PowerShell tabs to this object by using scripts or by using the menus in Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: See Also
trans-unit.target: See Also
